rationale_recruitment: All 7 conspiracy positions are filled. No replacement needed - current agents provide optimal faction coverage and Turn 5 abilities are extremely valuable.

actions.effect: FREE placement of 4 influence cubes in Docks district
actions.reasoning: Blackbeard's Turn 5 ability unlocks today - 4 FREE cubes to Harbormaster Office (4 VP). Currently empty square, guarantees control. Establishes Docks presence for potential Maritime dominance.

actions.effect: FREE placement of 3 influence cubes in Palace district
actions.reasoning: Valorian's ability places 3 FREE cubes in Palace. Target Throne Room (4 VP) - highest value Palace square. Currently empty, guarantees control.

actions.ability: 5 Flip one opponents agent face down
actions.effect: Target opponent's agent becomes face-down (cannot use abilities, reduced influence generation)
actions.reasoning: Shadow's Turn 5 ability is devastating. Target P3's Marcus Venditti - their ONLY active Commercial agent. This eliminates their Market district access (they control Market!), crippling their faction coverage for the remainder of the cycle. P3 is leading by 10 VP - this disruption is critical.

district_influence.reasoning: Royal Chamber (3 VP) - Military faction allows Palace access. Empty square, guaranteed control.
Council Room (2 VP) - Adjacent to PAL_01 and PAL_05. Building Palace control chain.
Royal Garden (2 VP) - Central Palace square with 4 adjacencies. Strategic positioning.

influence_placement.courtier_note: Due to faction bug (only Military faction recognized), cannot place on Noble courtier COURT_007 this turn. Military courtiers: COURT_006 already controlled (1/1), COURT_005 has P3's 2 influence (would need 3 to flip, but pool is better used for Palace VP).

free_actions.reasoning: CRITICAL - I am currently SCAPEGOAT with highest exposure (12). Cycle 2 whitewash cost = 4 gold per point. Spending 12 gold reduces exposure by 3 (12 to 9). This reduces scapegoat risk while preserving 6 gold for future needs. At exposure 9, I may still be scapegoat but gap is reduced.
As Barracks district controller, I get free influence removal each turn. Target P3's Market dominance - remove 1 cube from MKT_02 (Merchant Guild). Reduces their district lead incrementally.

strategic_reasoning.turn_5_opportunity: Turn 5 unlocks Blackbeard's 4 FREE Docks cubes and Shadow's agent-flipping ability. Both are powerful abilities that require immediate exploitation.
strategic_reasoning.exposure_management: At exposure 12, I am guaranteed scapegoat (-3 VP at cycle end). Whitewashing 3 points costs 12 gold but is mathematically sound - 3 VP saved is worth 12 gold at cycle-end conversion rates.
strategic_reasoning.vp_gap_analysis: P3 leads by 10 VP (54 vs 44). This turn adds approximately 9 VP from Palace (4+3+2) plus 4 VP from Docks = 13 VP potential. Plus abilities saved 7 influence cubes (worth ~4 VP equivalent in efficiency).
strategic_reasoning.disruption_value: Flipping P3's Marcus Venditti eliminates their only active Commercial agent. They control Market district but lose ability to defend it or use its controller power effectively.
strategic_reasoning.cycle_end_preparation: After this turn: Palace partially controlled, Docks presence established, exposure reduced. Next 2 turns should focus on courtier completion for petition VP and further exposure reduction.

noble_charter.blocked_by: Faction bug prevents Noble courtier placement this turn. Must resolve in Turn 6.

imperial_mandate.notes: High priority for 12 VP. Requires securing both COURT_005 and COURT_007.
